intro: Codonopsis macrantha, commonly known as the Chinese ginseng or the "golden bell" plant, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant produces a fleshy, spindle-shaped root that is often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and medicinal purposes.
